Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; shame about the nocturnal construction noise.”
Reviews.Author: Stephan H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is safe, friendly, good value for money and central. During my stay there was considerable noise from construction work nearby at 3am. However, I still did feel rested enough the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Good beer and really friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Spamette
Reviews.Content: To be fair we didn't use the hotel facilities (i had to put a score in that field to complete the review) but we used the bar a few times and really liked it. The staff were entertaining and kept feeding us the most gorgeous hot snacks on the house. These guys can certainly cook, which in our experience during this last visit to Amsterdam, is rare. We'd certainly eat there if we go again.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Genn12
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff just simply poor state of rooms in the attic. Stay away from attic room especially room 14. I think the main problem is no point in investing as idiots seems to smash the top floor up such as kick holes in doors, punch marked in ceilings, etc. The lower floors seem to be fine as well as great bar area, superb location and staff were fab.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: MrsHomerSimpson
Reviews.Content: I normally am of the view "you get what you pay for" but not on this occasion - a group of us were booked in here but did not stay in the end - some rooms lovely and fresh but one very smelly as was the stairwell. It is not expensive but it is also not cheap so would've expected better for money - good location but there is better to be had if you shop around which we did

Reviews.Title: “Yummy food!”
Reviews.Author: experimentaltraveler
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the hotel, but dined at the cafe and it was one of the best (and most reasonably priced) meals we had over our week stay. The baked mussels and the veal were done perfectly and the wait staff were attentive and friendly. The only "problem" was that we had to find the waitress to get our check...no rush here! We stayed about a block away and tried many area restaurants, but this is the place I would return to first.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal to store bags and sleep”
Reviews.Author: rem_east_mids
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 "basic" rooms for one night for a stag weekend; Excellent position just round the corner from Dam; Very friendly staff, accommodated an early arrival to drop off bags before heading into town; Rooms very basic, we experienced no hot running water to the room and WC; but beds very comfortable. Night porter available for late night / early morning returns; Suitable for groups just needing a bed to sleep & store baggage. Single glazed windows overlooking tramlines and bus route; Cafe acceptable but no worse than rest of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: matt_1376
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews I wasn't really sure what to expect. First, the best thing about this hotel is that it is less than a 10 minute walk from Central Station and Dam Square is a couple of minutes around the corner. The member of staff who greeted me was friendly and was actually expecting me. I paid 70 euros for 2 nights accomodation and even got a receipt which is like a little card with your check in and check out dates and which you need to gain access after hours. So, what did I get for 35 euros a night? I asked for a room with a view and when I booked the booking confirmation said I had a private bathroom. Well, my single room was right on the top on the fourth floor - actually the attic. The room was basic with a sink and I even got a towel and soap. There was a TV which switched on but had no aerial. There were 2 small angled windows in the roof, neither had curtains and the latch on 1 window was broken and the window was held open with a small plank of wood. On the 4th floor was one other room and we had to share a toilet and shower. The toilet was clean and had paper, but the light in the shower wouldn't turn on properly and the door didn't lock. The stairs from the ground floor were very steep. The hotel staff were always friendly when I saw them but I didn't think it was worth complaining about the defects in my room. I'd only recommend this hotel from people on a very tight budget who don't expect luxury, and I wouldn't pay more than 35 euros a night, because for the location you can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “over priced tatty rooms and surly service”
Reviews.Author: AliceCristal
Reviews.Content: We knew we'd made a mistake when we were greeted by the barman with a rude: "We're full!!" When I told him we had a reservation he told me to "wait 5 minutes" with no apology. As we made our way up the vinyl tatty staircase I already knew we had paid way over the odds (about Â£135) for our double room. The room itself was clean-ish but otherwise very grotty and it took us ages to get the door to close! Then there was no loo roll in the toilet. The overhead lighting was so dim you couldn't read by it and the side lamp did not work. There was no soap and no glass or plastic cups to drink from. I've had better rooms in Egypt for Â£10 a night! And breakfast in the cafe below was also overpriced and very poor. Avoid!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodations - good value”
Reviews.Author: dougamsterdam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times and I would recommend this place for travelers on a budget. location is good, about 2 blocks from dam square, 3 blocks from the red light district, and a 10 min. walk to central station. rooms are spartan but clean and available with or without private bath. be aware that rooms are located above the cafe/pub that also serves a the hotel office. after pub hours you must knock at the door to gain access to your room. the staff is very friendly (except for one broad with an attitude) also note that there is no elevator and no bell staff, so you will have tote your own luggage up a narrow staircase. This is not the hotel Krasnapolsky, ( I've stayed there) but you can stay here for a week for the cost of 1 night at the kras.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Budsa
Reviews.Content: Over the Easter Weekend, two friends and I cycled from London to Amsterdam and back via the Harwich to Hoek Ferry (just got back yesterday and my legs don't feel like they will forgive me for a while!). Amsterdam was absolutely rammed over the Easter weekend and the Corner House was one of only a handful of budget hotels available when we booked 3 months in advance and the only one with three rooms available (excluding dorms/hostels). We booked out of desperation to have somewhere to stay despite having read some very negative reviews on here and I felt I had to post a review here to document our favourable experience of the place, if only to offer a bit of balance. It's not the Ritz but the accommodation was of a satisfactory standard, clean with towels, soap and shower gel provided. The room sizes seemed to vary quite a bit - two of us were on the fifth floor which only has two rooms on it (12 and 14). 12 is large and encompasses what used to be '11' (an extra locked door onto my room shows a wall has been removed - they would have been tiny rooms before) whereas 14 is a little over half the size. Our other friend was on the first floor and I didn't see his room. There is a shared shower and toilet per floor and the one on the fourth and fifth floors were clean and worked well (although the light flickered in the shower on the fifth floor). There is a strong family resemblance between the members of staff and they were certainly very warm in their greeting when we arrived. The bar serves as a check-in desk and we were asked to pay for the rooms in advance. We showered after check-in and arranged to meet back in the bar so we had the opportunity to have an Amstel there while we re-grouped - the staff were again full of smiles and very welcoming. We returned to the hotel a little after 9pm (the day's cycling having taken its toll) and the bar was now full but the staff gave us our keys back very quickly. Contrary to tales of sleepless nights, I slept like a log. The streets in the centre of Amsterdam are very noisy at night so I think being on the fifth floor probably helped to dampen it a bit - I certainly slept very well. I didn't get to try the breakfast as we checked-out first thing, keen to see a bit more of Amsterdam before we headed back out on the road. I would stay there again. By the way - there is secure bike parking at MacBike in the Centraal Station (east and west sides) for E1.20/calendar day. We used it overnight with some reasonably flash bikes without incident.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accommodation - But GREAT location, perfect for short break”
Reviews.Author: Ash034
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is a great pick for location - just off Dam Square right in the middle of shops, bars and restaurants which is perfect for a short weekend break where you dont tend to spend alot of time in your hotel anyway as you are out and about. Its a basic room with tv, bathroom and towels included - NOTE there are no toiletries or hairdryer, so you may want to take that with you. The tram line does run outside the hotel so can be a little noisey, but when drinking in the evenings you dont tend to notice when you get in! It is above a pub - nice cosy vibe in pub with reasonably priced drinks. Wouldnt recommend the restaurant as its overpriced for basic food - i.e. 8 euro's for a basic tuna salad. Overall good for basic accommodation - perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Its Cheap and Cheerful. A real bargain.”
Reviews.Author: Dannyton1971
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Amsterdam in May 2011 for a meet up with my friends from England. As they had already booked their accomodation and couldnt change to a bigger room , I was left with the unenviable task of findong myself a single room which wasnt too pricey, was safe and was also central. I had looked at a few others and came to Cafe Corner House. I found myself quite wary due to some of the postings and comments about this hotel on Tripadvisor. The room I booked was a single with shared toilet/Shower. I was given the room directly above the bar, and when shown to my room I was generally pleased. It was clean and it was most certainly safe, and I also had a great view from the window. Ok..maybe it was a bit noisy with the trams. However i have been to Amsterdam many times and this is almost always the case. In the room there was a small telly - with BBc1 - and a small sink and wardrobe with hangers. THey had also left me a bar of soap and a small towel (however I had taken my own towel as I always do) The manager was called Theo and in my honest opinion you couldnt have met a nicer person. He and his family are originally of Turkish descent, and they were soon talking away to me about life in general , maybe its a Scottish thing but I found each and every member of staff in the hotel to be friendly courteous and very very helpful. I have been to Amsterdam before and done all the usual pubs and trips with my pals and we had a great time watching the climax of the English premiership ni the Globe Sports Bar. We had also watched the end of the Scottish season the day before there and again the staff and the locals couldnt have been more welcoming. They even gave us a couple of free drinks when Bob and Rons team (Chelsea) won the premiership with an 8-0 win over Wigan. Also had a few beers and a game or two of pool in Cafe Mooy. Had more beers and a wee sing song as well as people watching in the Bar De Stoof. We tended to round off our nights by visting Cafe De Zon at Niewmarket , where Maartan - a good friend - will look after you and serve you beer until closing time. On the way back I had a few in the hotel with my pals and with Theo. As I have said you couldnt have met a nicer person. Tis was also the time of the Icelandic volcano blowing its top and causing disruption to flights. On the Sunday it had started up again and all the airports in Scotland had closed due to the cloud. I mentioned this to Theo as I was a bit concerned about having nowhere to stay. He took me to the side and told me not to worry as he would ensure that I had a roof over my head if I couldnt get home. it was a major relief to hear that as i didnt fancy having to sleep rough!! I hadnt taken my credit card or my bank card! i have said before about my room being directly above the bar. This was good for 2 reasons...I didnt have far to go after a night cap, and it was busy enough to wake me from my hungover slumber at 9am. Thus ensuring I didnt waste my trip lying in bed feeling sorry for myself. As luck would have it Glasgow Airport was opened on Monday and I travelled back to Scotland having had another exceptional weekend in Amsterdam. If and when I return then I and my friends will all be staying at the Cafe Corner House! Cheap and Cheerful. if you are nice to them then they are nice to you! if anyone has any queries then jus mail me!

Reviews.Title: “***WARNING*** Don't stay here, terrible hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: 4two4
Reviews.Content: This hotel listing should come with a warning!. Staying at this hotel must be one of the worst experiences I have ever had. The staff were rude, lazy and abusive and refused to give a written receipt on checkout. The one young man who appears to be related to the owner, is ultra abusive, aggressive and approaches the guests in a threatening manner. Room size is best described as pokey. There is a lot of street noise very early in the morning which was only made worse by the loud music played late into the night. If you complain, there was NO response. The barman who seems like the only person in the place to oversee the guests hands out keys on request, so that security is non existent. The hotel reeks of tobacco smoke and clients often light up in the bar despite the law in holland against smoking in public spaces. The hotel manager (barman) was made aware that this was illegal under the Dutch laws but he could not care less. Toilet had no lighting and was located on a landing at the top of the stairs, which would prove very difficult for any special needs folk that required assistance. One has to squeeze past the toilet bowl, to enter the room. The shower facility was almost as bad with dated decor and positive smell of urine. The free internet WiFi does not work for more than 5 - 10 seconds, again the staff could not care less. The only positive thing I can say about this hotel is it's location, but that is irrelevant if one has to endure the dreadful staff at this establishment. Unfortunately I had not read the previous reviews or I would NEVER have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there at any cost you can get better for same money”
Reviews.Author: ahluwalia5
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel in Amsterdam without doubt, I would prefer to sleep in a dustbin next time. The reservation said private bathroom it was a shared dirty ancient bathroom with no light. The shared toilet was disgusting. We tried to pay by card they couldnt take it as their machine didnt work or as he said the reception who we never saw wasnt there. So paid in cash no receipt. This is no more than a crappy dark and dingy out dated pub with ghetto rooms not worth it from any score. The law in Amsterdam is no smoking however they had staff and clients all smoking if not doing drugs. My bedding smelt of Smoke and had no sound proofing. Their staff are untrained monkeys who mostly cant speak Dutch nor English very unhelpful I think they were Iranians straight from the banana boat. when asked for a receipt the young boy started arguing with us and he was just the barman didnt even have anything to do with the hotel side. He has issues and should be cleaning streets not speaking to humans as we did understand his swear words ..... I am reporting to the hotel to their Tourist board as can only damage the reputation of a fine City. I sincerely recommend this so called hotel be closed down and may be of low Tehran quality but not acceptable in Europe

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LPJR
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now. I had no problems, it is rough round the edges. It's not a place I would take the wife for a romantic weekend but as a base to tour the city with friends it is fine. The room I stayed in was quite large for Amsterdam, it had two comfy beds with clean bedding. We had no problems with staff, always friendly. Served a beer on arrival. Able to leave luggage in secure room on booking out date. The only reason we have not booked it this year is because its lost its value for money ticket. Corner House alway use to be a good 20% cheaper than its nearby rivals but no more.

Reviews.Title: “morning desk clerk ... rudest pr_ck I've ever met.”
Reviews.Author: mikedada
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a week this year, and though the hotel was OK, and the staff were mostly pleasant, the morning person was rude, arrogant and came close to a beating...he yelled, bullied, and haraunged me, and other guests . later, I found out , that he is the son of the owner. And that this is not uncommon. if you enjoy being rung up at 9.30am to be intimidated and yelled at...this is the place for you. otherwise give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “terriable place very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: tim99_10
Reviews.Content: the staff that run this place are very ignorant and rude will never tay here again too bad because it is in nice location

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: madmonkey718
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam a dozen times, and stayed at many expensive hotels, but it took me until my last visit to find the perfect place to stay... The Hotel Cornerhouse. As people have noted, it's not the ritz, your not paying for the ritz, so stop complaining. Plus, you're in Amsterdam, so might as well get outside and do something. I basically slept in my room and sometimes came back to drop off items, change clothes, etc. Clean, Secure, and the very friendly and personable staff were very good to me. The price is awesome, so what can I say? This place is perfect for me!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Awful Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: angelsrushin
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a very basic, cheap but clean, friendly hotel/hostel and instead we got a horror version of Fawlty Towers. Over the years I have stayed in budget hotels and hostels in Germany and Prague and expected this hotel to be similar - I was very wrong. Yes it was in a great location, and yes I was expecting the very basic accommodation, but the service we received from the staff was abysmal. We went to this hotel on a girly holiday for New Year and on more than two occasions I was made to feel very uncomfortable and genuinely frightened by the male staff. After complaining about being put in a room which we had not booked and asking for the hotel to fix the rooms light (which did not work and remained broken through out our visit) the barman (as there is not a dedicated reception and any problems have to be discussed at the bar in full view of all visitors) became very hostile, when I told him there was no need to yell, he told me there was no need to stay. I have never experienced any service like this in the past. On our second night staying there we had an abusive phone call at 4am to the room, screaming because they believed we had male guests in the room ( which we did not) after the phone call, one of the barman came to our room and started yelling and screaming at us, as I was scared for my well being and not used to being spoken to like this by a much larger man, and worried about the other guests in the hotel, I kept apologising in hopes he would leave. After a ten minute abusive rant he eventually left. Loud music played every night till 4 in the morning (and we were on the third floor so God knows how the first and second floor coped) The only way we were able to sleep was by listening to our mp3 players every night- but I would recommend ear plugs. The photo's on here do not resemble the room or bathroom we had. Our bathroom was very old fashion, tiny and decorated in awful 1960's brown dÃ©cor. We also had a container of rat poison in our room, and on the last night was woken by rustling in our bin, we then discovered a rodent. A very sleepless night followed and we were all incredibly relieved to leave this hell hole of a "hotel" the next day. It really was the worst "hotel" experience of my life. And I would certainly not recommend this place for any groups of women staying, as we were treated with absolutely no respect.

Reviews.Title: “Old and worn, but OK with GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Ruthebest
Reviews.Content: We also stayed here for new year, the hotel was very busy and please note it is family run. The family where run off there feet, i found them to be nice to us. Alex and his dad work extra hard to keep this place going and his mom in the resturant. The hotel is right on top of Dam Square, great location for everything.... Ok it's not the Ritz'a but you dont pay the price of the Ritz's, so stop moaning and get out and enjoy the city. Who spend all there time in the room??? It was old and worn, but the beds where clean and the bathroom clean, white sheets and fresh towels every day ! Who could ask for more??

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: rocknic1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over New Year and it was probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Please do not stay here!! 1. We paid for an ensuite 3 bedroom and were booked into a 3 bed shared bathroom room without notification and they refused to move us or give us any sort of refund. They shouted at us in front of customers in the bar below and told us to find another hotel. The staff are very rude. 3. The main light was broken in our room and they told us they would send someone up to fix it but this did not happen. 4. The staff made us feel unwelcome throughout our time there. 5. Loud music was played until 4am every night meaning that it was very difficult to get to sleep. 6. I suspect there was a mouse or rat in the room as there was a white box next to the sink containing what looked like rat poison! I also heard a rustling noise, which sounded like a rodent on the last night. 7. There was no safety deposit box and no information about Amsterdam. In fact there was not even a proper reception area! Everything was done from behind the bar. Find another hotel if you go to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Spudilike
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel experience I have ever had. We were on the top floor in a room that was absolutely freezing. On our first (and only) night in the "hotel" we were woken up with water pouring through the ceiling due to a drunk hotel supervisor attempting to fix the heating (at 2am). The next morning I tried to have a shower in the dirty bathroom but the cold water tap did not work and only scalding hot water came out - that was the final straw - thankfully we left and checked in to a lovely Eden hotel and our 2 night stay wasn't ruined but if we hadn't found another place to stay I would have happily walked home rather than spend another minute in that hovel.

Reviews.Title: “great value, indeed”
Reviews.Author: drewua
Reviews.Content: im just back from my hols in amsterdam and got to stay there. the reason to choose was the price, location and no really bad reviews on a number of forums. got to admit all good words are true. i guess for a budget hotel as its been positioned it has all hands up. their booking system is a little bit oldfashioned (big book with handwritten notes at reception/bar) but its not my business. my room was great and even facing the main street i had no problem with the outter noise, but probably those sencitive to it have to keep it in mind and get earplugs handy... no matter what i really doubt you can get similar quality for same price right in the heart of amsterdam. btw, the staff is great, friendly, always helpful and all smiles everytime i got in touch.

Reviews.Title: “No Thrills..Just decent cheap rooms”
Reviews.Author: lfcmad2002
Reviews.Content: My self and my friend have just stayed here for 3 nights,Having drunk in the bar several times over the years i thought i would try there rooms as they were only 35 euro for a single En suite.I was a bit worried about the reviews on here,but my moto is for this money don't expect much in return,but show them respect and you normally get it back.On arrival we were greeted by Becky..Very friendly she was too,ok so she was chuffed more Scottish People had walked in after last weekend,but that`s another story.We got our keys for room 8 and 9 3 rd floor up steep stairs (Good fun after a night out) The rooms were single En Suite and were Huge.Small cheap bed,cupboard,tv,sink,tables,chair,hairdryer,shower and toilet.Although it prob not been decorated for a while it was clean.New towels were left on the sat,but not sun/mon,no big deal.The walls are very very thin and yes you can here folk speaking etc as for the windows they were not much better.The hotel is on a busy corner and you hear trams all night,but you get used to it.On the sunday they were doing roadworks at 2am-4am right outside,so that was not great,but no fault of hotel..At night the bar closes at 2am at weekend,but you ring bell and the night porter lets you in and get your key on showing your card.check out is by 1030am and they will call you at 10am to remind you So over hall it`s a clean,safe,friendly place with decent sized rooms right next to Dam Square from 35euro room only,loads of places local for breakfast inc Irish bars and English Bars etc

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: SheddyOne
Reviews.Content: You check-in / out in the bar on the ground floor. Payment was demanded upfront. Service was generally brusque, but not unfriendly. The communal areas are dated, but clean. I was on the 3rd floor (4th floor for Americans) the stairs are narrow and steep, like many hotels in Amsterdam. The rooms are also very basic, but again are clean on arrival. I spent 3 nights here and the bed wasn't made, the toilet / sink / shower weren't cleaned, but I got a clean towel every day. All this would have been fine for the money I paid (just 35 Euros per night for a single en-suite room), except for the noise from the trams. It is extremely noisy from early morning until well gone midnight. If you are on a budget and need to stay here, invest in a pair of earplugs! The upside of the noisy location is that you're very close to everything. 10 mins walk from Central Stn, and just a few mins walk to Dam Sq / Jordaan / Leidseplein.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: J_Baye
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the Corner House over last weekend. It was our first time there but have been to Amsterdam many times always staying in budget hotels and have no complaints whatsoever about the hotel. Check in was no problem and included a couple of complimentary beers. The room was clean and warm with fresh towels supplied daily. It was in a great location just behind Dam square and a 10 minute walk from Central station. I have stayed in many hotels around the world of all supposed standards and I admit I did spot a bit of paint cracking, and a small cracked tile but hey come on guys it was â‚¬60 for a clean ,warm, room, with friendly staff in the centre of a great city. Call me a simple soul but I don't need much more in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Barmaid: Threatened Us with Pepper Spray”
Reviews.Author: WelshYank
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three night several weeks ago. The hotel itself is fine, if basic, great for the price. But we had a horrific experience with the barmaid, who verbally abused us and threatened my friend with pepper spray. I made reservations directly with Theo, the owner, via e-mail, and gave him my credit card as a guarantee. So, when we checked in, and the barman didn't ask for payment up front, we just assumed that since they had our credit card details, we could pay when we checked out. Unusual for this type of establishment, but not unheard of. On the third day, the barmaid called the room at 10:30 am and told us it was check out time. We explained we were staying another day. But when we went downstairs, she demanded we pay our bill. However, the charges were higher than what we had been told by Theo in the e-mail. When we told her this, she got this bizarre Stepford Person grin on her face, and kept insisting that we had to pay the amount she demanded, because it was written on the paper. She ignored us when we tried to show her our printed e-mails with a different rate. She refused to phone Theo and said he would be in later, and we could talk to him about it, but we MUST pay the amount she wanted right then. We decided to pay it, as we were concerned she would go into our room and possibly damage our belongings. We also told her we wanted to have a late check out, but of course, were willing to pay for it. She then said we could only do that if we paid for a full night, and the amount she wanted to charge was again much higher than we had been quoted by Theo for one night. When we returned that evening, the barman who had originally checked us in was there, and said not to worry, he mentioned that the barmaid was a bit crazy, and said we should wait to see Theo the next day, he would be in around 11 a.m. Well, the next morning, psycho barmaid again called at exactly 10:30 and demanded we vacate the room. We asked her to call Theo, and she refused. We said we were going to wait in the room until Theo came. She then came charging up the stairs, banged on our door and started shouting at us that we had to get out, someone was waiting downstairs to rent the room. When we said we would stay in the room until Theo got there, she replied, "Wanna bet?" and tried to grab our suitcases. I shut the door on her, and she shouted, "You like pepper spray, [--]?" In the end, another gentleman came up about half an hour later, with the barmaid and her Stepford grin in tow, and said he was in charge when Theo wasn't here, that he would refund the overpayment if we would please vacate the room. Which we did with pleasure. I don't think we did anything wrong here. This woman would not listen to anything we said (she definitely understood us, her English was fine) and just had this ridiculous sickly grin on her face the entire time she was abusing us. If not for her, I would have given this hotel four to five stars, as a basic, cheap, convenient, comfortable accommodation, But I do not appreciate being threatened, and would suggest anyone staying there stay away from the daytime bar woman.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here”
Reviews.Author: shutsy
Reviews.Content: We're a gang of ten male adults in our 40s and we stayed here for three nights.I booked the hotel and was a bit apprehensive given some feed back left by others.I shouldn't have worried.On arrival we were all given a free beer and showed to our rooms.They were a bit dated but clean and tidy.This hotel does what it says on the tin, it is cheap and cheerful, with helpful staff and a bar below.Enough said!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: mma5587
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many budget and non-budget hotels throughout Europe and this one was by far the WORST! Our room smelled of old, stale cigratte smoke which was absolutely horrible. It made my stomach sink each time we walked in. What was worse was the shower in the bathroom. The walls were covered with black mold spores which did not look too hard to clean (just bleach). And I was the first person to take a shower and there were long black hairs on the shower walls - YUCK! They obviously did not clean it between guests. It was the first shower to make me cringe during all my travels over the years. The hairdryer also did not work and when I called the desk to let them know they didn't have any response just that it should work if I plug it in (which I had). Additionally, they require that you leave the key at the bar and show a card with your room number to receive your key. Well, while we were at the bar one night another guest asked for our room key and they gave it to him without asking for verification. Luckily after a few minutes he realized that it wasn't his room and asked for the correct one (this is when I realized what happened or I would have chimmed in earlier). However, it definitely let me see that our belongings were not safe. We only stayed in this hotel for two nights, if it had been longer I would have quickly changed. Overall, I would not stay here again and wouldn't definitely never recommend it to my friends - and this is the first time I have ever said this! The location is its only plus side but you can find much better hotels for the same price (or at least clean ones). DON'T DO IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Euro”
Reviews.Author: Actionfilter
Reviews.Content: This is a good option, if you are say stuck and looking at only high rates for the time you will be in town. I stayed here in late May for a few days. I was charged 35Euros per night for the weekend a couple of weeks before my trip. I loved the location being just off Dam Square very central. The room was OK, clean, and big enough. I liked the views from the windows, being so central is rare for me. Honestly though with no breakfast incl. and my being a big coffee drinker, you need to add 10 Euros to this rate. The bathroom and shower were shared. Never did I have to wait for the shower and not signigicantly for the toilet. The atmosphere of the bar, a Dutch brown bar, I enjoyed, as I no longer go to bars in my life, so it was a nice experience, hearing the conversation, some of the folks were singing songs, and the music selection was to my liking especially later at night, alot of 60-70's songs, Dionne Warwick, etc. So this was no hassle at all for me, this noise from the bar. Since I never sleep much when in Amsterdam I had no problems with the street noise, which is a contant all night really, tho it tapers down after about 3am or so. Personally I was ready to retire on the hours they close the bar which is 1am weeknight and 2:30am Friday and Sat. It was shown to me how to buzz for entry after those hours. I am not sure what one would do to LEAVE the place after those hours. To get to your room the bar man gives you the key and it's a side door and staircase. I beleive there is a outside door in that area so maybe that is how you leave the room at 2am on a Thursday night. or maybe you buzz them. It wasn't explained to me. It coud be an issue for some or even myself in the future. They run a tight ship here and you don't have to be concerned about things like being hassled or other residents making too much noise or disturbance. My Tv was without a remote which is not a big deal. Most channels were Dutch with one or 2 from UK and CNN. good enough. I would stay here again under the same conditions of the alternative being 85Euros a night and up, or if under severe budget constraints at all times. The owners and managers are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: abiholland
Reviews.Content: basically we have been visiting this hotel for about 10 years. It is cheap simple, clean, and wonderfully located. Dont expect any thrills, but in short thsi place just works for a budget get away in this wonderful city. The key is that it is open 24h a day so you can do your thing in the city and not worry about a curfew!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, welcoming, cheap and basic.”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuggirl77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Corner House over Easter weekend 2008. After reading reviews on here I was prepared for a frosty welcome, and well my experience was fantastic. We walked in and the bar was busy with locals singing along to europop oompah type music, the bar maid beckoned us to the end of the bar, shook our hands enthusiastically and welcomed us heartily. She found us some seats and offered us a drink on the house while we filled out our guest cards. I had booked directly from the email on the website and had no problems with our booking, they were expecting us. The rooms are all above the bar on 2 floors, our room, room 1 was directly above the centre of the bar, if you want a silent stay then i wouldnt pick that room, having said that once the bar closed at 2am (sat) / 1am it was peaceful and fine. The music starts up again at about 8.30am. Yes the staircase is narrow and steep but if you have ever been in any dutch building you will know this is the norm, and this one was better than many i encountered! What do you expect in a tall narrow old building!?! The room was VERY basic, 2 low single beds, a sink in the corner, and a TV. The shower and toilet facilities are shared and a little chilly at this time of year! Make sure you arent last one into the shower on a busy bank holiday weekend- there was no hot water left! This is sounding very negative and it shouldnt be. These are the only down points. The Corner house has so many good points and reasons to stay! It is VERY cheap, we paid 70 euros a night over easter weekend for the room not Per person. The next cheapest 1 star central hotel was over 90. Yes it is basic and old fashioned but it is very clean. The location has to be its biggest selling point, you really couldnt get more central if you tried in my opinion, you are 10 min walk from Anne Franks House, right on Dam Square and 2 mins from the shops. A 5 min walk from the famous red light area and everything is within reach in a few minutes really. It took us 15 mins to walk up from the station with our bags. If you dont want to walk, Trams stop outside the hotel at Dam stop. The drinks in the bar were also the cheapest we found in the weekend and the bar has a lovely atmosphere with varied and eclectic music, from Queen to the grease megamix and traditional Dutch oompah sounding stuff! It was great and everyone was friendly. The barmaid let us leave our bags down in their cellar for the day as we had to be out at 10.30am but our flight wasnt till the evening, very handy! I think that is everything. To sum up, be prepared for a lively bar, clean but basic room, fantastic location and lovely people. Any questions please ask. x

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Corner House”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirelass022
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the hotel corner house. It is in a good location near to all the attractions. The staff are very friendly. The room was clean, we had a ensuite twin room. The bedding was clean and the mattresses confortable. We paid 60 euros a night for the room, which I think in Amsterdam for an ensuite is a bargain. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: butch_wade
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel from a recommendation on the forums. It's a good clean budget hotel with a nice cafe bar, in a great location, on Gravenstraat which runs between Nieuwzijds Voorburgwal and Nieuendijk, and only 2 minutes walk from Dam Square. We arrived early, and after checking in, and being given a free drink, the lady on duty let us have the room early at 11:00, instead of the 13:00 quoted check in time. Don't think of booking this hotel if you demand luxury, but if you want a clean room with a comfortable bed and a decent bathroom in the centre of Amsterdam, it's well worth considering. Our twin room cost â‚¬80 per night. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, and all in all, it's a good choice for a weekend visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TimmoSouthampton
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review literally hours after returning from my stay at the Corner House. We booked this hotel through e-mail with Theo which was quick and without problems. On arrival we were greeted by a lady who welcomed us with a drink on the house and gave us a piece of paper to fill out. She was kinda friendly but also seemed to have a rude vibe about her. After we filled in our details, we waited and waited to be seen again, I then went to give my details in to the lady but she told me to wait a bit whilst she did something. Fair enough I thought because it was quite busy in the bar. The next thing I saw was her chatting with customers and then left to go home! I went up to the new person behind the bar (Theo) and I gave him my details and he seemed quite shocked that I hadn't been given my key to the room. He was very helpful and really friendly. After walking up the steep stairs (no lift), we found our room had 2 twin beds (We asked for a double but i'm not sure whether they are all twins) a cupboard, 2 plastic chairs, a table and a sink outside of the bathroom (which contained a shower and a toilet) and a TV with around 30 channels (inc. BBC1, BBC2, CNN, BBC World News, Discovery Channel and National Geographic as the English speaking channels). The room wasn't the largest but suited us as it was just a base to leave our stuff and to sleep. The bed was comfy but we only had 1 pillow each which weren't that great. Each day we were left some fresh towels outside our door which became a stand-in second pillow for me! The location of the hotel was brilliant. It was right next to Dam Square and is next door to the massive church next to the palace. It meant we didn't have to get up early to get to places as it was right next to everything we needed. Despite it being next to Dam Square, the hotel was quite peaceful and rarely heard much noise at night. The hotel was also next door to a cafe which served breakfast, lunch and dinner. This was ideal as the hotel didn't serve food. The cafe serves a great traditional breakfast...how do I know? Because I ate one every day of my visit! lol! Check out is at 10:30. When we left we received a call just before 10:30 to remind us. As our flight was in the afternoon, they allowed us to keep our luggage in their cellar until we came back to get it. Best 3 things about our experience at the hotel: - The location!! Next to everything 'touristy' - En-suite bathroom - Room was tidy, beds were clean. Worst 3 things about our experience at the hotel: - The room was cold - the radiator didn't work - Checking in could have been quicker. - Being woken up at 4.30am by the fire alarm and jumping out of bed whilst having the best dream in the world, then putting my t-shirt on backwards and stumbling down the stairs in my PJs looking like death and having the tallest morning hair in the universe in front of random people only to be told that everything was alight.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mjrp
Reviews.Content: The corner house offers a great location and a welcoming dutch accomodation. The room was fine, though the walls were thin. It was nice but for the mice !

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away! Honestly the worst place I have ever encountered.”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyKate
Reviews.Content: After reading all the glowing reviews on this site for this hotel, I thought it sounded perfect for us; within budget, central and friendly. How wrong I was. When we arrived, and told the woman behind the bar that we had a reservation, she welcomed us by demanding to know how I had booked. When I told her that I had emailed she then said that we couldnt possibly have done that as the hotel didnt make reservations via email. When I told her I had emailed the owner, called Theo, she said 'Oh. Well, whats your name then?' She was SO rude to us; making me repeat my name 3 times, then saying there was no reservation, When I persued it, and said that there must be, as I had the print out of the email with me, she conceded that perhaps there was a reservation in my name. It was honestly the most bizarre experience I have ever had in a hotel; it was as if she REALLY didnt want us to stay. I should say at this point that both my husband and I were well dressed, completely sober (!) and very friendly and polite. Eventually she shoved a check-in card at me and demanded I fill it in. When I asked if that meant that she had found our reservation, she said very sarcastically that "obviously" that is what it meant. She was horrid! Througout all of this we were both incredibly polite, and it was just the starngest thing to have someone be so openly aggresive and rude, for no apparent reason! Once I had filled in this, she immediately asked for our credit card. Not being silly, I asked if we could see the room first, before paying for it, as to be honest the service we had so far was truly shocking and I had serious doubts about the hotel by then. She became even more aggresive at this request and literally threw the keys at me. In a state of shock by this point, I took them and went to look at the rooms. The hotel bit is above the bar and you have to climb a steep starcase to get to the rooms. There are many rooms, and the rooms we saw (some doors were open) were truly BASIC. Very, very old furnishings. It seemed clean enough, but was really Hostel standard. Twin beds, threadbare bedding and strip lighting. I had decided by now that there was no way on earth I would stay in this hotel, primarily because of how unbeliveably rude the woman at the bar had been. I think even if she had been the most welcoming and kind person on earth I would not want to stay in a hotel of that standard however. It was not good. We returned the keys and said we were not staying with them, primarily because of her attictude. SHe became very aggresive again and challenged me tofind anywhere else in Amsterdam to stay the night, shouting 'Good luck!' sarcastically as we left. We walked 50 yards down the street and booked into the nearest hotel, which unsurprisingly, was SIGNIFICANTLY better. All in all, it was the worst hotel experience both me and my husband have ever had. It actually left a really bad taste in our mouths regarding AMsterdam as a whole. I would not usually bother writing a review but I have to say as this experience was so bad, I want to prevent others from having to go through anything like this themselves. If you are considering staying at this hotel, do yourself a favour and stay away. I wish I had!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: SylviaGlasgow
Reviews.Content: What a great little gem of a hotel this was. I didnt know what to expect as the price was so cheap and it had an excellent location (just off Dam Square), but i needant have worried, it was perfect for what we required. As its basically a hotel above a bar there is no reception therefore check in is done at the bar. The owner "Theo" is fantastic, really friendly and made everyone welcome. The rooms are what you expect of a budget hotel, basic but have everything you need and they are quite spacious. Most of the rooms are en suite but some arent so remember to specify this when booking. All rooms also have a TV. This hotel is also on a room only basis as they dont serve breakfast in the bar. The bar in the hotel is also great. Its quite small but has bags of Amsterdma character. At the weekends the music is cranked up and everyone has a sing song but as its only open until 1am its not much of a problem for the other guests. I have now been to Amsterdam 4 times and i am going again this year and staying in the cornerhouse hotel. After staying here i would never stay anywhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Cafe Corner House
HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 119 121, Amsterdam 1012 RH , The Netherlands
